Instruction:
Task Description: Implement an Android input capture provider that uses TCP socket communication to interface with a native evdev reader process for handling input events from rooted devices.

Class Description: EvdevCaptureProvider is an Android input capture implementation that establishes a TCP server to communicate with a native evdev reader process running with root privileges. It handles input event capture and forwarding while managing the lifecycle of the socket connection and root process.

Attributes:
- listener: [EvdevListener] - Callback interface for handling input events
- libraryPath: [String] - Path to the native library directory
- shutdown: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether the provider should terminate
- evdevIn: [InputStream] - Input stream from the evdev reader socket
- evdevOut: [OutputStream] - Output stream to the evdev reader socket
- su: [Process] - Root process running the evdev reader
- servSock: [ServerSocket] - TCP server socket for accepting connections
- evdevSock: [Socket] - Socket connection to the evdev reader
- activity: [Activity] - Android activity context
- started: [boolean] - Flag indicating if the provider has started
- handlerThread: [Thread] - Thread handling the socket communication

Methods:
- EvdevCaptureProvider([Activity activity, EvdevListener listener]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the capture provider with activity context and event listener
- destroy() -> [void] - Cleans up resources including sockets, streams, and terminates the root process
- reportDeviceNotRooted() -> [void] - Displays a toast message when the device isn't rooted (private helper method)
- run() -> [void] - Thread implementation that establishes the server socket, launches the root process, and handles event reading (inner Thread class method)
